column1: #Text=, a region of France which is southeast of Paris and north of Lyon .
#Text=The town of Vézelay ( less than 500 inhabitants ) is associated with the pilgrimage to Santiago de Compostela .
#Text=For centuries , pilgrims departed from this town or passed through it during their pilgrimage .
#Text=These days , Vézelay is visited by hundreds of pilgrims , and that number is increasing every year .
#Text=Nevertheless , these pilgrims represent only a fraction of the total number of people visiting the city .
#Text=The dominant Basilica Sainte-Marie-Madeleine de Vézelay , located on the highest point of the city , is a distinctive landmark and has been on the UNESCO World Heritage List since 1979 .
#Text=There is no train station in Vézelay .
#Text=The closest SNCF station is in Sermizelles .
#Text=From there SNCF buses drive to several destinations including Vézelay .
#Text=Consult the SNCF ( TER ) web page for more detailed information .
#Text=In Avallon you can continue your trip to Vézelay by taxi .
#Text=SNCF ( TER ) buses pass Vézelay departing from : Sermizelles , Clamecy and Corbigny .
#Text=From the north and the east , the fastest way to reach Vézelay is by the A6 Autoroute that runs from Paris to Beaune ( access 21 and 22 for Avallon ) .
#Text=You will find a free parking lot just outside the city walls .
#Text=From the parking lot , a staircase leads to Place du Champ de Foire and Rue Saint Etienne which is the street up to the basilica .
#Text=You can easily go around on foot .
#Text=Drive or take a taxi if you want to visit the beautiful Église Notre Dame in the nearby village of St. Père , which is just below the hill that Vézelay is on top of .
#Text=This large cathedral , in mixed Romanesque/ Gothic style , is a traditional place for pilgrims to start their pilgrimage to the great Romanesque cathedral in Santiago de Compostela .
#Text=The basilica is free to visit between 8AM and 8PM .
#Text=If you like , you can participate in a tour to get more information about the structure and history of the building .
#Text=There are a few tours a day and they last one and a half hours .
#Text=Usually the guides speak French , sometimes English .
#Text=More information about the exact times are available at the basilica or visit the website .
#Text=You can walk all around the outside of the basilica .
#Text=At the back is a park with a beautiful view , great for a picnic .
#Text=, 14 , Rue Saint Etienne , ☏ +33386323926 , ✉ musee-zervos@cg-89.fr . 15 Mar-15 Nov. W - M 10AM-6PM .
#Text=In July and August open on Tuesdays too .
#Text=It has a collection of paintings and sculptures of famous artists like Picasso , Ernst , Calder , Miro , Giacometti , Laurens , Leger and Vieija da Silva . € 3 .
#Text=It exhibits original sculptures from the basilica .
#Text=Walk trail GR654-II from Vézelay to St. Père and visit the local church Église Notre Dame .
#Text=There are a lot of restaurants to serve the large numbers of tourists .
#Text=, Place du Champ de Foire , ☏ +33386332123 , ✉ contact@laposte-liondor.com .
#Text=, 22 , Grande Rue , 89450 Saint-Père ( Just a mile south of Vézelay ) , ☏ +33386333910 , ✉ reservations@marc-meneau.com .
#Text=A two-star restaurant of famous chef cook Marc Meneau
#Text=, Place du Champ de Foire , ☏ +33386332212 , ✉ sarl-cheval-blanc@wanadoo.fr .
#Text=– Vézelay is located in the far north of this 290,900 ha big park with only 50,000 inhabitants in 117 communities .
#Text=It ’s a relative quiet hilly area with forests and lakes .
#Text=In summer some lakes like Le Lac des Settons are populair tourist destinations .
#Text=The old fortress city Avallon is just 17 km east of Vézelay
#Text=is located on a wooded hillside near the village Bazoches 10 km south of Vézelay .
#Text=The castle was built in 1180 by Jean de Bazoches .
#Text=Over the years it had several owners until in 1675 king Louis XIV bestowed the castle to Sebastien Le Prestre de Vauban .
#Text=Vauban was a military designer who used the castle for studies and drawings of 300 fortresses and fortified cities .
#Text=The current owners , descendants of the eldest daughter of Vauban , Charlotte de Vauban , preserved many sumptuous furnishings of their famous ancestors .
#Text=The Château has been designated as a historical monument and can be visited from March until November .
